trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Configuring connectivity to SQL Server running on an Azure Virtual Machine does not differ dramatically from the steps required for an on-premises SQL Server instance.
trans-unit.target: Configuring connectivity to SQL Server running on an Azure Virtual Machine does not differ dramatically from the steps required for an on-premises SQL Server instance.

trans-unit.source: You still have to work with configuration steps involving the firewall, authentication, and database logins.
trans-unit.target: You still have to work with configuration steps involving the firewall, authentication, and database logins.

trans-unit.source: But there are some SQL Server connectivity aspects that are specific to Azure VMs.
trans-unit.target: But there are some SQL Server connectivity aspects that are specific to Azure VMs.

trans-unit.source: This article covers some [general connectivity scenarios](#connection-scenarios) and then provides [detailed steps for configuring SQL Server connectivity in an Azure VM](#steps-for-configuring-sql-server-connectivity-in-an-azure-vm).
trans-unit.target: This article covers some [general connectivity scenarios](#connection-scenarios) and then provides [detailed steps for configuring SQL Server connectivity in an Azure VM](#steps-for-configuring-sql-server-connectivity-in-an-azure-vm).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This article focuses on connectivity.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This article focuses on connectivity.

trans-unit.source: For a full walk-through of both provisioning and connectivity, see [Provisioning a SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure](virtual-machines-provision-sql-server.md).
trans-unit.target: For a full walk-through of both provisioning and connectivity, see [Provisioning a SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure](virtual-machines-provision-sql-server.md).

trans-unit.source: Connect to SQL Server over the Internet
trans-unit.target: Connect to SQL Server over the Internet

trans-unit.source: If you want to connect to your SQL Server database engine from the Internet, you must create a virtual machine endpoint for incoming TCP communication.
trans-unit.target: If you want to connect to your SQL Server database engine from the Internet, you must create a virtual machine endpoint for incoming TCP communication.

trans-unit.source: This Azure configuration step, directs incoming TCP port traffic to a TCP port that is accessible to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This Azure configuration step, directs incoming TCP port traffic to a TCP port that is accessible to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: First, follow the [steps in this article to configure connectivity](#steps-for-configuring-sql-server-connectivity-in-an-azure-vm).
trans-unit.target: First, follow the [steps in this article to configure connectivity](#steps-for-configuring-sql-server-connectivity-in-an-azure-vm).

trans-unit.source: Any client with internet access could then connect to the SQL Server instance by specifying the cloud service DNS name (such as **mycloudservice.cloudapp.net**) and the VM endpoint (such as **57500**).
trans-unit.target: Any client with internet access could then connect to the SQL Server instance by specifying the cloud service DNS name (such as **mycloudservice.cloudapp.net**) and the VM endpoint (such as **57500**).

trans-unit.source: Although this enables connectivity for clients over the internet, this does not imply that anyone can connect to your SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: Although this enables connectivity for clients over the internet, this does not imply that anyone can connect to your SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: For additional security, don't use the well-known port 1433 for the public virtual machine endpoint.
trans-unit.target: For additional security, don't use the well-known port 1433 for the public virtual machine endpoint.

trans-unit.source: And if possible, consider adding an ACL on your endpoint to restrict traffic only to the clients you permit.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] It is important to note that when you use this technique to communicate with SQL Server, all data returned is considered outgoing traffic from the datacenter.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] It is important to note that when you use this technique to communicate with SQL Server, all data returned is considered outgoing traffic from the datacenter.

trans-unit.source: It is subject to normal [pricing on outbound data transfers](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/data-transfers).
trans-unit.target: It is subject to normal [pricing on outbound data transfers](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/data-transfers).
